article.headline: Boston U. 66, Maine 55
article.story: ORONO, Maine (AP)Tyler Morris scored 19 points and Boston University handed Maine its first loss in six outings 66-55 Wednesday night. The Terriers (8-12, 5-3 America East) began the second half with a 13-3and never looked back as the Black Bears (10-12, 5-5 America East) committed 13 turnovers in the second half. A Chris Bruff hook shot drew Maine within one at 46-45, but the Terriers forced turnovers on the next six possessions to pull away. Maine led early on the strength on 12 points from Philippe Tchekane Bofia, who was whistled for his fourth foul early in the second half. With Bofia on the bench, the Black Bears managed just one point over the next 10:00. After falling behind in the first half, the Terriers reeled off an 11-0 run to take their first lead of the game. The Black Bears responded with ten unanswered of their own, but BU closed the gap within two at halftime, 35-33. Carlos Strong added 15 points and Scott Brittain chipped in 13 for the visiting Terriers, who won at Alfond Arena for the seventh straight year dating back to 2000.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
